content:
Hey, I am looking for information around support for inline assembly using asm! and external assembly linked in, in const fns.
The background is implementing cryptographic primitives (especially BigNums) using const fn is very useful, but to get the required performance I need assembly based parts, as Rust/LLVM can't quite generate the required code.

I can say from the outset that asm! will never be supported in const fn or anywhere else around constants. But, we just got the very unstable and very unsafe (we don't even know its soundness conditions properly yet) const_eval_select so you can experiment with that on nightly
there are no plans for stabilizing it though
it should probably eventually be stabilized eventually for simple ergonomics reasons
thanks, this does solve my issues quite nicely, without requiring any of the other parts to happen
